p: Many phytochemicals found in taro display the potential to reduce oxidative stress. The H-ORAC (Hydroxyl Radical Antioxidant Capacity), ABTS (2,2′-Azino-bis[3-ethylbenzothiazoline-6-sulfonic acid] diammonium salt), FRAP (ferric reducing antioxidant power), and DPPH (2,2′-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl radical assay) methods have been applied to evaluate the TAC of taro extracts or taro-food derivatives. Flavonoids, tannins, saponins, alkaloids, carotenoids, phenols, vitamins, and fatty acids seem to contribute to overall taro antioxidant capacity ( Table 3) [ 13, 52, 53, 69, 70, 71, 72, 73, 74, 75, 76, 77, 78, 79, 80, 81, 82, 83].
